result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: DA's discovery letter to defense re: pages 1 - 23 plus 1 DVD
Notice of hearing - hand written and provided to the Def. in Court.
$1000.00 cash bond was converted to a $3000.00 signature bond w/same conditions.

Absolute sobriety, no illegal drugs, only prescription medication with a valid prescription.  No use or possession of alcohol.    No entry into any Class B licensed establishments.  No travel outside the state without prior court approval.

10:11 am. Atty. Kaupie appeared on behalf of the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Kolell apperaed in person w/John Waubanascum (i/c). Atty. Kolell waives reading and enters not guilty pleas to both counts. 
PTC set for 02-23-2022 at 3pm with ARF.  FPT set for 03-30-02022 at 3pm in Branch 1.

10:11 am. Atty. Kaupie appeared on behalf of the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Kolell apperaed in person w/John Waubanascum (i/c). Atty. Kolell addresses the Court as his client wishes to waive his right to a PH.   Defense waives the preliminary hearing.  Court advises party of their right to a preliminary hearing, accepts waiver and binds over for Arraignment. Atty. Kaupie informs the Court/Atty. Kolell that the INFO will be filed and will mirror the criminal complaint. Based on that represenation, Atty. Kolell wishes to proceed directly into the ARGN today.

Absolute sobriety, no illegal drugs, only prescription medication with a valid prescription.  No use or possession of alcohol.    No entry into any Class B licensed establishments.  No travel outside the state without prior court approval.

10:11 am. Atty. Kaupie appeared on behalf of the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Kolell appeared in person w/John Waubanascum (i/c). Atty. Kolell addresses the Court with his furlough request or conversion of cash bond to signature bond. Atty. Kaupie addresses the Court. The State takes no position on the furlough request but objects to the cash bond being converted to a signature bond.
Ruling of the Court: The $1000.00 cash bond is converted to a $3000.00 signature bond with the same conditions.
